channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How one attack is reshaping the fight over immigration policy
item.description: The aftermath of the D.C. attack has brought tightened security and new immigration limits from the Trump administration.
item.content:encoded: The aftermath of the D.C. attack has brought tightened security and new immigration limits from the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: West Virginia's governor on what the D.C. shooting means for his state
item.description: West Virginia Governor Patrick Morrisey discusses the D.C. shooting that targeted two Guard members from his state.
item.content:encoded: West Virginia Governor Patrick Morrisey discusses the D.C. shooting that targeted two Guard members from his state.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Robbins

item.title: Why Missouri's redistricting battle matters heading into the midterms
item.description: St. Louis Public Radio's Jason Rosenbaum examines whether Missouri Republicans can legally redraw districts mid-decade simply because the state constitution doesn't prohibit it.
item.content:encoded: St. Louis Public Radio's Jason Rosenbaum examines whether Missouri Republicans can legally redraw districts mid-decade simply because the state constitution doesn't prohibit it.
item.dc:creator: Jason Rosenbaum

item.title: Northwestern settles with Trump administration in $75M deal to regain federal funding
item.description: The university will pay $75 million over three years to end the Trump administration's investigations into antisemitism on its campus and to have millions of dollars in federal funding restored.
item.content:encoded:
The university will pay $75 million over three years to end the Trump administration's investigations into antisemitism on its campus and to have millions of dollars in federal funding restored.

(Image credit: Teresa Crawford)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: A major winter storm disrupts travel as millions head home after Thanksgiving
item.description: The storm will spread through the Midwest and Great Lakes regions over the weekend with "widespread heavy snowfall and hazardous travel conditions," the National Weather Service said.
item.content:encoded:
The storm will spread through the Midwest and Great Lakes regions over the weekend with "widespread heavy snowfall and hazardous travel conditions," the National Weather Service said.

(Image credit: Jared McNett)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Retired Maj. Gen. James Hoyer on the shooting of 2 West Virginia National Guard members
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks to retired Gen. James Hoyer of the West Virginia National Guard following Wednesday's shooting that left one guardsperson dead and another critically injured.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon speaks to retired Gen. James Hoyer of the West Virginia National Guard following Wednesday's shooting that left one guardsperson dead and another critically injured.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: How the small hometown of the accused shooter of 2 National Guard members is reacting
item.description: Authorities say the suspect who shot two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday, drove from his home in Bellingham, Washington, to carry out the attack. Here's how that city is reacting.
item.content:encoded: Authorities say the suspect who shot two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday, drove from his home in Bellingham, Washington, to carry out the attack. Here's how that city is reacting.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Norris

item.title: Why landline phones still matter in California
item.description: Landline telephones can be a lifeline when disaster strikes remote towns. NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Yue Stella Yu, a reporter for CalMatters, about why landlines remain important in California.
item.content:encoded: Landline telephones can be a lifeline when disaster strikes remote towns. NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Yue Stella Yu, a reporter for CalMatters, about why landlines remain important in California.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: This man serenades tourists in a Boston park with a taste of their homeland
item.description: We meet a man who serenades tourists in a Boston park with songs of their homeland in their native language. He's got a song for almost any nation.
item.content:encoded: We meet a man who serenades tourists in a Boston park with songs of their homeland in their native language. He's got a song for almost any nation.
item.dc:creator: Craig LeMoult

item.title: As the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season ends, the future of forecasting is AI
item.description: Meteorologists are surprised that the weather model that did the best job forecasting hurricanes this year was a new one, introduced by Google. AI may be the beginning of a new era of forecasting.
item.content:encoded:
Meteorologists are surprised that the weather model that did the best job forecasting hurricanes this year was a new one, introduced by Google. AI may be the beginning of a new era of forecasting.

(Image credit: Ricardo Makyn)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen
